intro: Asplenium colubrinum var. taeniophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rock fern, is a variant of the common rock fern. It is a small, evergreen fern that typically grows in rocky or shaded environments. The plant features slender, leathery leaves with a distinctive narrow, elongated shape. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a finely serrated edge. This variety is often found in limestone soils and is adapted to thrive in humid, cool climates.
